description: All children shall have an officially recognized identity
title: I have an identity!
content:
From their birth on, children have the right to an officially recognized name and nationality and appropriate documentation of that identity. They have the right to know their parents when this is possible, and to be brought up by them, unless they have been legally and appropriately adopted by other parents or when a court has granted legal guardianship to other individuals with the best interests of a child as their guiding principle of care.

Every child’s identity shall be recognized, protected and documented. A child’s name, nationality, language, culture, and family relationships constitute part of a child’s identity.

If a child is deprived of his or her identity, state and local authorities should work to protect it and help re-establish it.
